parameters: \p4Can we at least see what Andy has in
stock? I bet he has some useful stuff
\p4Can we at least see what Andy has in
stock? I bet he has some useful stuff
\andyYou can use some of this stuff
\andyWell, I haven't seen you four around
Solus Valley yet, so welcome to town!
\andyAnd let me guess... you four are
the ones that saved Adon, right?
\andyWell, I'm glad to be able to
sell to you four! I'll do anything
over... care to buy some stuff?
\andyBefore you head out, I have a gift
for you. I'm sure you'll appreciate it.
\andyThis is an ancient dagger that was
\andyIt was most likely once very powerful.
on it, negating a lot of its magical
\andy...but I prefer to think that it's
lost its magic while sitting under all
\andyPlease take good care of it! I'm
sure that you will be able to one day
restore it to its former glory!
\andyIt's no problem. If anyone deserves to
keep this archaic weapon, it's you guys.
\andyIf you haven't yet, make sure to
check out my sister Clara's shop.
She has strong cleric items and
a variety of other magic items!
\andyOh, you four again! Glad to see
you, welcome back! Wanna' buy anything?
buy anything today. We would like
to ask you a few questions, though.
out on The Trail like us, right?
\andyThat really was that long ago, wasn't it?
Exploring the world, documenting new types
of monsters, and meeting new people day
after day... how I wish I could go back.
\andyI didn't want to retire, but after
seeing Clara get hurt the way she
did, I didn't want to see anything
bad happen to her ever again.
I couldn't bring myself to imagine what
could happen if she got injured like that
\andyShe had some of her own reasons too, I suppose...
\andySo then we stepped down. And, while I
do like selling to the new generation of
adventurers, I still feel a little bitter
that my career was ended so abruptly.
times when it's more enjoyable to think
\p3Yep, that's right... so I'm sorry that we
do have to talk about some negative stuff.
\p3Did you hear any rumors on your adventures that
pertained to maybe, like, gods or something?
Stuff that seemed crazy but maybe somewhat
believable to a degree, you know.
\andyThere used to be a guard outpost near
the broken bridge on the west end of the
Easin Plains. You know, that bridge that
\andyI remember we stopped there for a couple
nights to rest and restock. There was this
old man... no one really knew who he was or
how he got there, but he just felt... important.
\andyOne day, a group of three Tellurian knights
came over to the outpost. They escorted him,
presumably back to a town, but I remember him
reciting some sort of story to the them.
his immortality taken from him and then
being sent down here to the Overworld.
this \c[30]evil god's soul\c[0] has been unleashed
upon the Overworld. \c[30]It\c[0]'s said to be
\andyIf the man was crazy, he was certainly good
at hiding it. Everyone treated him like a saint,
and to be honest, with the power \c[18]Apocalypse\c[0] has...
\p3You know what... I agree, Andy. I have
some evidence that can potentially back
\p3Yeah. Things like... oh, this sounds stupid.
\p3On a more realistic note, though... an
evil god might explain why Trailia, the
goddess of adventure, has such a poor
\p3Well, thanks Andy. We appreciate the tip.
\andyNo problem! Feel free to stop by again anytime!
\p3With all that running around out of
the way, I say it's about time we go
\andyOh, you four again! Glad to see
you, welcome back! Wanna' buy anything?
\claraWelcome to my half of Andy and Clara's
Rogue and Cleric Store, home of the
a TON of other magic items!
down a bit, stop scaring the customers!
\claraAh, my bad. Sorry if I was
\p2Hey, a bit of enthusiasm never hurt
\claraWell, I already know that you four
have to be the ones that saved Adon.
have gotten really out of hand lately.
Everything is falling out of balance.
\claraAndy and I once had a quite a role
in the fight back in the day.
travelers to go finish the job.
do you want to buy stuff?
\claraIf you haven't yet, please visit my
brother Andy to the left. He's got great
equipment for rogues, which I'm sure
Would you like to buy anything?
\p3Maybe some other time... but not now. Can
we talk about something for a little bit?
\p3Nothing is going on... well, right now.
I'd like to inquire about your past. You
and Andy... adventurers like us, right?
\claraOh, yes, of course! Those were our
glory days! The best time of my life!
was the best life I could have been
\claraIt took some time, but I did decide
to end it after watching Andy go through
some awful troubles with his back.
\claraThere were days he couldn't even get
up out of bed after all the fighting
from the day before. It was so awful
to see his condition get worse and worse.
\claraHe also had his own concerns about
me... but I ended it for his own good.
We couldn't have continued much longer.
\claraBut you know what? I'm happy to be
watching from the sidelines, as long as
I'm still able to help the new adventurers
of today get some stronger equipment!
\p3That is a good way to see it... but aside
from all the fun parts of your journey, I'm
wondering if you encountered anything that's
\p3Assuming you were as outgoing as you are now,
you must have talked to a lot of people. Did
you ever hear any crazy stories or rumors about
anything related to \c[18]Apocalypse\c[0] or some gods?
\claraWell, as a matter of fact... yes.
\claraI once struck up a conversation with
another cleric. The things she told me...
\claraThose swordsmen chosen to be the champions
before the last Great Collapse a whole millenium
ago... she told me that they became \c[18]Apocalypse\c[0]
\claraI mean, it does kind of make sense.
But to confirm... was Laeryidyean, in
fact, good with a sword and magic?
does have some element of truth to it.
\claraHopefully it's made up, though... if it's
siblings, and I'm sure that \c[18]Apocalypse\c[0] would
stop at nothing to find who killed his brother.
\claraWell, \N[1]... I can only wish you good luck now.
\p3With all that running around out of
the way, I say it's about time we go
Would you like to buy anything?
in front of the counter, please.
\clara...can you please try to stay on
the customer's side of the counter?
